oaidtb.boosters
Class AdaBoostM1

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--weka.classifiers.Classifier
        |
        +--weka.classifiers.DistributionClassifier
              |
              +--oaidtb.boosters.Booster
                    |
                    +--oaidtb.boosters.AdaBoostM1
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, ErrorUpperBoundComputer, IterativeUpdatableClassifier, MulticlassExtensibleBooster, weka.core.OptionHandler, java.io.Serializable, weka.core.WeightedInstancesHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
AdaBoostM1W
public class AdaBoostM1
extends Booster
implements MulticlassExtensibleBooster, ErrorUpperBoundComputer

Class for boosting using AdaBoostM1. For more information see:

Yoav Freund and Robert E. Schapire: A decision-theoretic generalization of on-line learning and an application to boosting. Journal of Computer and System Sciences, 55(1):119-139, 1997.

Version:
$Revision: 1.0 $
Author:
Santiago David Villalba Bartolomé
See Also:

reweight

protected void reweight(weka.classifiers.Classifier baseClassifier,
                        double beta)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Assign new weight to every instance in the training dataset based in the classifier's vote weight and if it classifies correctly the instance. We use a "conservative boosting approach", only increasing the weights of misclassified instances. This update will be exp(beta) if beta is > 0 or exp (-beta) otherwise.
Parameters:
baseClassifier - The base classifier
beta - Factor in term of which misclassified training instances weight will be updated
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If there is a classification error

getTooBigError

public double getTooBigError()
Returns:
The value considered as a "too big error" for base classifiers

setTooBigError

public void setTooBigError(double tooBigError)
Set the error value which will be considered as the upper limit for the base classifiers training error and will be used to determine the stop criterion of the algorithm.
  • If >1 ==> there is no stop criterion
  • If <=0 ==> the default value will be used
    Parameters:
    tooBigError - The value

    • getMaxNumOfTooBigErrors

    initializeErrorUpperBound

    updateErrorUpperBound

    protected void updateErrorUpperBound(double error)
    Update the theoretical training error upper bound.
    
  - Note that if the error of the base classifier is greater than 1/2 the bound is undetermined,
    and so its calculation will be aborted.

  - Note that this is related to the current choice of the classifier's vote weight, so it will
    be invalid if this class is extended playing with its formulae (like in AdaBoostM1W);
    so the methods related to the training error must be overriden (with a silent noop if no bound
    must be calculated and returning 1 the method getErrorBound()).
    Parameters:
    error - The current base classifier's error

    setOptions

    public void setOptions(java.lang.String[] options)
                throws java.lang.Exception
    Parses a given list of options. Valid options are:

    
 -B
 Calculate the training error upper bound (default false).

 -E bigErrorValue
 Set the value considered as "too big error" in the (base classifier) training procedure; it will
 be used as an stop criterion.
  - If less or equal than zero, it will be reset to the default value.
  - If bigger than 1.0, no stop criterion will be applied.

 -C maxNumOfBigErrors
 Set the number of times after that, happened a value considered as "too big error" in the training procedure,
 the classifier will stop to iterate.
  - If less or equal than zero, no stop criterion will be applied.
  - Default: 1

 -V
 The "big errors occurrences" mustn't need to be consecutives to provoke the stop.

 Plus the rest of the superclass options.
    Overrides:
    setOptions in class Booster
    Parameters:
    options - the list of options as an array of strings
    Throws:
    java.lang.Exception - if an option is not supported

    public java.lang.String[] getOptions()
